definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
many hairs make a fur coat (idiom); many small contributions add up to sth big/many a mickle makes a muckle
to follow in one's father's footsteps
lit. stout horses and light furs/fig. to live in luxury
lit. light furs and stout horses/fig. to live in luxury
lit. to wear one's coat inside out and carry firewood on one's back (idiom)/fig. to live a life of poverty and hard work/fig. to act stupidly
Julius Caesar, 1599 tragedy by William Shakespeare 莎士比亞|莎士比亚

pinyin: qiu2 xin1 shi4 ji1 rou4 wei1 suo1 zheng4

definition: lit. to trade a fur coat for wine (idiom)/fig. (of wealthy people) to lead a dissolute and extravagant life

sentences.english: Our fur-clad descendents will be crouched over fires.
sentences.chinese: 我們的子孫將穿裘裹皮，蜷縮在火堆旁。

sentences.english: Meg and Jo fed their mother like dutiful young storks.
sentences.chinese: 麥格和裘像一對忠實的小鸛似地喂她們的母親。

sentences.english: Jo wrathfully proposed that Mr. Davis be arrested without delay.
sentences.chinese: 裘怒衝衝地提議，應當把戴維先生毫不遲延地逮起來。

sentences.english: That seemed to satisfy Lord Jonos.
sentences.chinese: 裘諾斯伯爵似乎對此很滿意。

sentences.english: I don't remember when Racial started to become my daughter's best friend.
sentences.chinese: 我不知女兒從什麼時候開始和瑞裘成爲至友的。

sentences.english: His black fur coat was white with snow.
sentences.chinese: 他的黑色裘皮大衣是雪白色。

sentences.english: Jo-Jo put icing and candles on the cake.
sentences.chinese: 裘裘把糖霜和糖果放在蛋糕上。

sentences.english: Jo-Jo put icing and candles on the cake.
sentences.chinese: 裘裘把糖霜和糖果放在蛋糕上。

sentences.english: Jo's ambition was to do something very splendid.
sentences.chinese: 裘的志向是想轟轟烈烈地大幹一番。

sentences.english: Did you get to the part where Cujo throws himself at the car ?
sentences.chinese: 你看到庫裘自己去撞車的那一幕了嗎？

sentences.english: She was wearing a new fur coat and looked like a million dollars.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一件新裘皮大衣，看上去非常漂亮。

sentences.english: They got a big bag of sweets.
sentences.chinese: 裘裘和媽媽還買了一大袋糖果。

sentences.english: They got a big bag of sweets.
sentences.chinese: 裘裘和媽媽還買了一大袋糖果。

sentences.english: Sueook at that lovely fur coat, mum.
sentences.chinese: 媽，看那件漂亮的裘皮大衣。

sentences.english: Mike and Joy are still talking in front of the performing arts shelf.
sentences.chinese: 邁可和裘伊仍在表演藝術書架前談天。

sentences.english: Not food may be broken Jo well Kennedy put.
sentences.chinese: 未食五月糉，破裘唔甘放。

definition: old place name (in modern Linyi county 臨猗縣|临猗县, Shanxi)/two-character surname Linghu
first month of a season/eldest amongst brothers
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat
surname Di/generic name for northern ethnic minorities during the Qin and Han Dynasties (221 BC-220 AD)
